metadata.title: CVE-2021-4083 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A read-after-free memory flaw was found in the Linux kernel's garbagecollection for Unix domain socket file handlers in the way users callclose() and fget() simultaneously and can potentially trigger a racecondition. This flaw allows a local user to crash the system or escalatetheir privileges on the system. This flaw affects Linux kernel versionsprior to 5.16-rc4.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4083` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-223-generic - 4.4.0-223.256~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-223-generic - 4.4.0-223.256~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-223-lowlatency - 4.4.0-223.256~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1103-aws - 4.4.0-1103.108
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1131-azure - 4.15.0-1131.144~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-223.256~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1103.108').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1131.144~14.04.1').
